title: The Lady Detectives
description:
4 X 45 Mins

Four crime dramas, where the common element is that the protagonist is a woman. Three of them are set in the Victorian / Edwardian period and one in the 1920s /1930s; three are set in southern England, one in New York.

The stories are:

1) The Redhill Sisterhood by Catherine Pirkis

A group of nuns are suspected of being in league with a gang of thieves who are targeting country houses

2) Mr Bovey's Unexpected Will by L T Meade and Robert Eustace

An eccentric miser leaves his fortune to whoever weighs nearest its weight in gold

3) The Golden Slipper by Anna Green

A New York socialite is called on to clear another girl's name when the latter is suspected of being a serial thief

4) The Law and the Lady by Wilkie Collins

A newly married woman finds her husband was suspected of murdering his first wife
